issueDTO.title: HTTPRequest node fails to execute when API key used for authorization is empty
issueDTO.description:
### Self Checks

- [x] This is only for bug report, if you would like to ask a question, please head to [Discussions](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/discussions/categories/general).
- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report (我已阅读并同意 [Language Policy](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/1542)).
- [x] [FOR CHINESE USERS] 请务必使用英文提交 Issue，否则会被关闭。谢谢！:)
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Dify version

1.5.1

### Cloud or Self Hosted

Cloud

### Steps to reproduce

(This is not a new bug in v1.5.1. It has existed for a while.)

1. Import the following DSL
2. Execute the chatflow with arbitrary inputs.

This bug also exists when the "Auth Type" is set to "Bearer" as the following image:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4afdb2d4-0d2e-4205-bd78-f758a974ddda)

###  DSL

<details>

```yaml
app:
  description: ''
  icon: 🤖
  icon_background: '#FFEAD5'
  mode: advanced-chat
  name: HTTP Node Test
  use_icon_as_answer_icon: false
dependencies: []
kind: app
version: 0.3.0
workflow:
  conversation_variables:
  - description: ''
    id: 6d24f13b-b93a-4b81-a871-0e3a5d1ca83b
    name: Token
    selector:
    - conversation
    - Token
    value: ''
    value_type: string
  environment_variables: []
  features:
    file_upload:
      allowed_file_extensions:
      - .JPG
      - .JPEG
      - .PNG
      - .GIF
      - .WEBP
      - .SVG
      allowed_file_types:
      - image
      allowed_file_upload_methods:
      - local_file
      - remote_url
      enabled: false
      fileUploadConfig:
        audio_file_size_limit: 50
        batch_count_limit: 5
        file_size_limit: 15
        image_file_size_limit: 10
        video_file_size_limit: 100
        workflow_file_upload_limit: 10
      image:
        enabled: false
        number_limits: 3
        transfer_methods:
        - local_file
        - remote_url
      number_limits: 3
    opening_statement: ''
    retriever_resource:
      enabled: true
    sensitive_word_avoidance:
      enabled: false
    speech_to_text:
      enabled: false
    suggested_questions: []
    suggested_questions_after_answer:
      enabled: false
    text_to_speech:
      enabled: false
      language: ''
      voice: ''
  graph:
    edges:
    - data:
        isInLoop: false
        sourceType: start
        targetType: http-request
      id: 1750841625928-source-1750841632262-target
      source: '1750841625928'
      sourceHandle: source
      target: '1750841632262'
      targetHandle: target
      type: custom
      zIndex: 0
    - data:
        isInLoop: false
        sourceType: http-request
        targetType: answer
      id: 1750841632262-source-answer-target
      source: '1750841632262'
      sourceHandle: source
      target: answer
      targetHandle: target
      type: custom
      zIndex: 0
    nodes:
    - data:
        desc: ''
        selected: false
        title: Start
        type: start
        variables: []
      height: 54
      id: '1750841625928'
      position:
        x: 80
        y: 282
      positionAbsolute:
        x: 80
        y: 282
      sourcePosition: right
      targetPosition: left
      type: custom
      width: 244
    - data:
        authorization:
          config:
            api_key: ''
            type: basic
          type: api-key
        body:
          data: []
          type: none
        desc: ''
        headers: ''
        method: get
        params: ''
        retry_config:
          max_retries: 1
          retry_enabled: true
          retry_interval: 100
        selected: true
        ssl_verify: true
        timeout:
          max_connect_timeout: 0
          max_read_timeout: 0
          max_write_timeout: 0
        title: HTTP Request
        type: http-request
        url: https://httpbingo.org/get
        variables: []
      height: 124
      id: '1750841632262'
      position:
        x: 380
        y: 282

        x: 380
        y: 282

      targetPosition: left

    - data:
        answer: 'status: {{#1750841632262.status_code#}}

          body:


          {{#1750841632262.body#}}'
        desc: ''
        selected: false
        title: Answer
        type: answer
        variables: []
      height: 140
      id: answer
      position:
        x: 680
        y: 282
      positionAbsolute:
        x: 680

      sourcePosition: right
      targetPosition: left
      type: custom
      width: 244
    viewport:
      x: 150
      y: 110
      zoom: 1
```

</details>


### ✔️ Expected Behavior

The execution succeeds.

### ❌ Actual Behavior

The execution fails with the following message:

> Run failed: Illegal header value b'Basic '

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9e7d06ed-ccc3-4437-90af-ec6d6181041f)
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
This failure happens because the HTTPRequest node always constructs an `Authorization` header for "Basic" or "Bearer" auth types, even if the API key is empty. When the API key is empty, the header becomes `Authorization: Basic ` or `Authorization: Bearer `, which is considered an illegal header value by the HTTP library and causes the execution to fail ([source](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/bb955806e042517831b232948c3f9f7150ac5fb6/api/core/workflow/nodes/http_request/executor.py)). The code only checks that the API key field exists, not that it contains a non-empty value.

As a workaround, avoid configuring HTTPRequest nodes with empty API keys for these auth types. If your workflow might have an empty key, consider adding logic to skip the HTTPRequest node or switch to "no-auth" when the key is empty. There’s currently no built-in validation or warning for this in Dify, so it’s a systemic issue, not a new regression.

No official documentation or existing issues address this yet. It would be helpful for the platform to add validation or user warnings for empty API keys in future releases.


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->
*To reply, just mention [@dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot).*

---
<sup>How did I do? [Good](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=great_response) | [Irrelevant](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=irrelevant_answer) | [Incorrect](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=incorrect_sources) | [Verbose](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=too_verbose) | [Hallucination](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=hallucination) | [Report 🐛](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=bug_report) | [Other](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=other)</sup>  [![Join Discord](https://img.shields.io/badge/join-5865F2?logo=discord&logoColor=white&label=)](https://go.dosu.dev/discord-bot) [![Share on X](https://img.shields.io/badge/X-share-black)](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=%40dosu_ai%20helped%20me%20solve%20this%20issue!&url=https%3A//github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/21830)

The root cause of this bug is that [httpx does not allow header values with trailing spaces](https://github.com/encode/httpx/discussions/1641). The correspond code is [here](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/bb955806e042517831b232948c3f9f7150ac5fb6/api/core/workflow/nodes/http_request/executor.py#L267) and [here](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/bb955806e042517831b232948c3f9f7150ac5fb6/api/core/workflow/nodes/http_request/executor.py#L274)

repository.description: Production-ready platform for agentic workflow development.
repository.name: dify

summary.main: The HTTPRequest node fails to execute when the API key used for authorization is empty, resulting in an illegal header value being constructed, which causes the execution to fail.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the HTTPRequest node to succeed when the API key is empty, without constructing an illegal header value.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by adding logic to skip the HTTPRequest node or switch to no-auth when the key is empty. There is currently no built-in validation or warning for this in Dify, so it's a systemic issue.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is related to the HTTPRequest node in Dify, a production-ready platform for agentic workflow development. The bug occurs when the API key is empty, causing the HTTPRequest node to construct an illegal header value. The workaround is to avoid configuring HTTPRequest nodes with empty API keys for Basic or Bearer auth types. The root cause of this bug is that httpx does not allow header values with trailing spaces.

issueDTO.title: Some environment variables documented in the CLI docs are missing in node manpage
issueDTO.description:
### Version

24

### Platform

```text
All
```

### Subsystem

doc

### What steps will reproduce the bug?

Run `man node` and view the `ENVIRONMENT` section

Compare it to https://nodejs.org/api/cli.html#environment-variables_1 ([permalink](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/8b199eef3dd4de910a6521adc42ae611a62a19e1/doc/api/cli.md?plain=1#L3204))

### How often does it reproduce? Is there a required condition?

Always

### What is the expected behavior? Why is that the expected behavior?

Whatever is documented in the CLI documentation should also be documented in the node manpage

### What do you see instead?

The following environment variables are missing:
 - `NODE_COMPILE_CACHE`
 - `NODE_DISABLE_COMPILE_CACHE`
 - `NODE_PENDING_PIPE_INSTANCES`
 - `NODE_TEST_CONTEXT`
 - `NODE_USE_ENV_PROXY`

### Additional information

They need to be added in the [appropriate node.1 section](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/8b199eef3dd4de910a6521adc42ae611a62a19e1/doc/node.1#L674).

Afterwords the following code, since no longer necessary, needs to be removed: https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/4b4aaf921fda21c329caf349b23c0620867e4e6c/test/parallel/test-cli-node-cli-manpage-env-vars.mjs#L24-L32
comments: hi i try to fix it, this is my first time fixing issues in open source projects

@HumaneLogic Great! It's nice to have you here, welcome to the project 😄 

If you need any help just let me know 🙂

@dario-piotrowicz thank you very much, i'm very excited , i have some questions
i added the missing environment variables and removed lines in test-cli-node-cli-manpage-env-vars
now i should git add . and git commit -m "" (with a proper message of course) 
or 
git add doc\node.1 test\parallel\test-cli-node-cli-manpage-env-vars.mjs and git commit -m ""  ?
 then just do git push?  or git push origin my-branch-name?
should i build the project?
 also is there a way i can see the results in mappage locally to see if they are accurate?
is this message good "doc: add missing environment variables to manpage and remove test workaround"?
sorry for so many questions

> [@dario-piotrowicz](https://github.com/dario-piotrowicz) thank you , i have questions

👋 

> i added the missing environment variables and removed lines in test-cli-node-cli-manpage-env-vars now i should git add . and git commit -m "" (with a proper message of course) or git add doc\node.1 test\parallel\test-cli-node-cli-manpage-env-vars.mjs and git commit -m "" ? then just do git push? or git push origin my-branch-name? should i build the project? also is there a way i can see the results in mappage locally to see if they are accurate? is this message good "doc: add missing environment variables to manpage and remove test workaround"? sorry for so many questions

Regarding git, yes run `git add doc\node.1 test\parallel\test-cli-node-cli-manpage-env-vars.mjs` (or simply `git add .` from the root of the repository) and then the commit, message, try to be concise since there's a character limit to it `git commit -m '"doc: add missing environment variables to manpage"` looks good to me 🙂 

Then you can simply run `git push`, although it'd be more convenient to you if you used a branch different from `main` (before running the previously mentioned git commands)

> should i build the project?

You don't necessarily need to build the project for this issue, if you want you can do that to make sure the test works as intended but if you don't the CI checks run on the PR will also validate that the test passes

How you build the project depends on your platform, you can find guidance about that and how to run tests here: https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/main/BUILDING.md

(but again you can skip that for this issue)

> sorry for so many questions

No worries 🙂
@dario-piotrowicz thank you, i created a PR #58924

> @dario-piotrowicz thank you, i created a PR #58924 

Fantastic, I'll review it tomorrow 😀 

By the way I forgot to reply to your question about making sure that it works as intended...

You can run `man -l doc/node.1` to view your locally updated manpage on Linux/MacOS (or under WSL in windows)
@dario-piotrowicz thanks

issueDTO.title: Terminal Animations should start once in view.

The Animation should play only once the terminal becomes visible.

 - Browser: Chrome

issueDTO.title: Update Project Profile: Website- Remove Daniel Franco
issueDTO.description:
### Prerequisites
1. Be a member of Hack for LA. (There are no fees to join.) If you have not joined yet, please follow the steps on our [Getting Started](https://www.hackforla.org/getting-started) page and attend an onboarding session.
2. You have already read our [How to Contribute to Hack for LA Guide](https://github.com/hackforla/website/blob/gh-pages/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Overview
We need to keep project information up to date so that visitors to the website can find accurate information.

### Action Items
- [x] In your IDE, open the `_projects/website.md` file.
- [x] Observe the existing syntax of the front matter block [^1] in the file.
- [x]  Find the `leadership` variable and remove the following:
  ```
  - name: Daniel Franco
    github-handle: FamousHero
    role: Merge Team
    links:
      slack: https://hackforla.slack.com/team/U076AV5ALPP
      github: https://github.com/FamousHero
    picture: https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/FamousHero
  ```
- [x] Verify the changes by viewing the following in your local environment and include before and after screenshots with your pull request:
  - [x] Website project page [^2]

### Resources/Instructions
[^1]: [Info about the front matter block](https://jekyllrb.com/docs/front-matter/)
[^2]: Project detailed info page URL: https://www.hackforla.org/projects/website
comments:
<!-- Template for a user to add their availability, and the estimated time for completion of the issue they have taken up-->

issueDTO.title: [ic-tree-item]: Dynamically removing nested tree items doesn't remove expanded icon
issueDTO.description:
### Summary of the bug 
When dynamically removing nested ic-tree-items, the expanded arrow is not removed.

### 🪜 How to reproduce 
Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/witwrurk?file=src%2Fapp.jsx&hideExplorer=1

Tell us the steps to reproduce the problem: 
1. Open root tree item
2. Wait 3 seconds for nested tree item to be removed
3. Root tree item still shows expanded icon

### 📸 Screenshots or code 
Example can be found in Stackblitz above.

### 🖥 📱 Device 
- Type: Desktop
- Device: Windows laptop
- OS version: Windows 10 
- Browser version: Edge 

### 🧐 Expected behaviour 
The expanded icon should disappear if there are no nested items

### 📝 Acceptance Criteria  
If relevant, describe in full detail the different interactions and edge cases that the component or patterns needs to fulfil. 

*Given that the root item contains nested items* 
*When the nested items are removed*  
*Then the expanded icon should disappear*

*Given that the root items contains nested items*
*When the nested items are removed*
*Then `onIcTreeItemExpanded` should no longer be emitted on click 

### 🚨 Urgency (low, medium or high)
High (due to not having a workaround)

- Low = Does not have significant impact and can be addressed at a convenient time without causing delays.
- Medium = Has moderate impact and should be addressed soon to avoid potential delays or complications.
- High = A critical issue which has significant impact and needs immediate attention to prevent major delays or blockers.
-->

### Additional info 
N/A
comments:

issueDTO.title: Backfill does not pass parameters to DAG runs
issueDTO.description:
### Apache Airflow version

3.0.2

### If "Other Airflow 2 version" selected, which one?

_No response_

### What happened?

I opened the Trigger Dag form in the Airflow 3 UI and filled in parameters under the section “Run Parameters” (or under “Advanced Options → Configuration JSON”). 

When I submit the form to backfill a historical date range, the DAG run is created and executes, but the parameters I entered are not actually passed into the tasks. Inside the task, references like {{ params.my_param }} or accessing context["params"]["my_param"] remain unset. 

Although the UI shows the parameters form, these values never make it into the task context. 

### What you think should happen instead?

When I trigger a backfill from the Airflow 3 UI and enter parameters in the Run Parameters or Advanced Options → Configuration JSON, these values should be passed to each DAG run created during the backfill.

Inside the DAG, I should be able to access them using:
	•	{{ params.my_param }} in templates
	•	context["params"]["my_param"] in Python code

This is how it works when triggering a single DAG run from the UI, so the behavior should be the same for backfills. The parameters entered in the UI should override the defaults defined in the DAG and be available in all backfilled runs.

### How to reproduce

1.	Create the following DAG:

```
from datetime import datetime
from airflow.decorators import dag, task
from airflow.models.param import Param, ParamsDict

@task
def test_backfill_with_params(params: ParamsDict):
    assert params.get("id") is not None

@dag(
    dag_id='test_backfill',
    start_date=datetime(2023, 1, 1),
    schedule='@daily',
    catchup=False,
    default_args={'owner': 'Gery', 'retries': 0},
    params={
        "id": Param(default=None, title="My id", description="My id", type=["null", "string"]),
    }
)
def test_backfill_dag():
    test_backfill_with_params()

test_backfill_dag()
```

2.	Go to the Airflow 3 UI.
3.	Open the Backfill modal for the test_backfill DAG.
4.	Set a date range (e.g., start and end: 2025-06-01 00:00 and 2025-06-02 00:00).
5.	In the Run Parameters section, set id = "1234".
6.	Trigger the backfill.

Expected: The DAG run(s) should pass "id": "1234" to the task, and the assertion should pass.
Actual: The parameter is not passed, and the task fails due to params.get("id") being None.

### Operating System

Mac OS 14.6 (23G80)

### Versions of Apache Airflow Providers

No providers

### Deployment

Docker-Compose

### Deployment details

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
comments: Let me take a look at this issue:)
Looks like a duplicate of https://github.com/apache/airflow/issues/51439

Ah, the issue was already closed, that’s why I didn’t find it. Sorry about that, I always try to avoid duplicates.

Should we continue the discussion here or would it make more sense to reopen the original issue?

Hi @GeryDeKocliko Since I haven't investigated the issue yet, could your please test your DAG with the latest main and post your results here? If everything goes well, we can close the issue :) Thank you.

issueDTO.title: ide --offline status does not replicate ide status behavior when offline
issueDTO.description:
### Actual behavior

The `--offline` flag is supposed to imitate the functionalities as if disconnected from the internet. 
Running `ide --offline status` still performs the IDEasy version check, which should not occur when offline.

```
Skipping git fetch on C:\Users\<user>\projects\IDEasy\settings because we are offline.
IDE_ROOT is set to C:\Users\<user>\projects
IDE_HOME is set to C:\Users\<user>\projects\IDEasy
You have configured offline mode via CLI.
Your settings are up-to-date.
Your version of IDEasy is 2025.06.002 which is the latest released version.
Your operating system is windows(10.0)@x64 [Windows 11@amd64]
Successfully completed ide (status)
```

### Reproduce

1. ide --offline status 

### Expected behavior

`ide --offline status` should not run the check for newer version.

```
Skipping git fetch on C:\Users\<user>\projects\IDEasy\settings because we are offline.
IDE_ROOT is set to C:\Users\<user>\projects
IDE_HOME is set to C:\Users\<user>\projects\IDEasy
You have configured offline mode via CLI.
Your settings are up-to-date.
Your version of IDEasy is 2025.06.002.
Skipping check for newer version of IDEasy due to lack of network connectivity.
Your operating system is windows(10.0)@x64 [Windows 11@amd64]
Successfully completed ide (status)
```

### IDEasy status

```bash
IDE_ROOT is set to C:\Users\<user>\projects
IDE_HOME is set to C:\Users\<user>\projects\IDEasy
You are online.
Your version of IDEasy is 2025.06.002-06_27_02-SNAPSHOT but version 2025.06.002-20250627.084814-7 is available. Please run the following command to upgrade to the latest version:
ide upgrade
Your operating system is windows(10.0)@x64 [Windows 11@amd64]
Successfully completed ide (status)
```

### Related/Dependent issues

#1160

### Comments/Hints

https://github.com/devonfw/IDEasy/blob/c47022f2c81c3f4f2845326eaafea6d8c1d9c694/cli/src/main/java/com/devonfw/tools/ide/tool/IdeasyCommandlet.java#L140

Changing `if(!this.context.isOnline())` to `if(this.context.isOffline())` at L. 140 inside IDEasyCommandlet.java should fix the issue.
comments:
Also this does not look right with `--offline`:

> You are online.
We could also look for other parts in the code, that use `!isOnline()` and check if it should be changed to `isOffline()`, so that offline-mode works more reliably

summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by changing `if(!this.context.isOnline())` to `if(this.context.isOffline())` at line 140 inside IDEasyCommandlet.java, as suggested in the comments.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'good first issue' and 'status', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with before/after screenshots or video if possible.

issueDTO.title: Detect existing Wireguard tunnels and choose a different port
issueDTO.description: When installing on a Linux machine that has existing Wireguard tunnels, Netbird still tires to use port 51820. Editing the config.json to a new port gets things running, but having it automatically detect that port 51820 is in use at first "up" would be great, as it could then pick an unused port
comments:

issueDTO.title: Implement RFC7807
issueDTO.description:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have written a descriptive issue title
- [X] I have searched existing issues to ensure the feature has not already been requested


### 🚀 Feature Proposal

We could implement a toRFC7807-method, which creates RFC7807-compatible JSON Response to FastifyError and use it in fastify 4 by default.

So we could create a new Error like this 
```javascript

  const NewError = createError('CODE', 'hey %s, I like your %s %s')
  const err = new NewError('alice', 'attitude', 'see you')
```

and then the resulting JSON would be:
```javascript
{
    type: "FastifyError",
    title: "FastifyError", 
    status: 500, // <-- statusCode
    detail: 'hey alice, I like your attitude', // <-- message 
    instance: '', // <-- here could be the route
    code: 'CODE',
    details: { }, // here could be the ajv error codes.
}
```

### Motivation

_No response_

### Example

_No response_

issueDTO.title: 2025 Spring AI Alibaba 技术博客/视频征集
issueDTO.description:
### Description

如果您在调研或者使用Spring AI Alibaba和Jmanus，欢迎<font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">大家用自己擅长的方式创作Spring AI Alibaba/Jmanus相关作品，并通过技术博客或者短视频分享Spring AI Alibaba/Jmanus的介绍、技术解析、最佳实践、使用案例。</font>

## 参与方式:
1.撰写技术博客或者制作视频，发布至个人博客、CSDN等开发者社区、B站、视频号等视频平台。
2.将文章/视频地址发布至此 issue 评论区。
3.投稿后通过这个地址[提交个人收件信息](https://survey.aliyun.com/apps/zhiliao/aX4Z_BS8a)



## 奖品说明
1. 社区参与奖（数量不限）：只要投稿的作者就可以获得阿里巴巴开源纪念品，咖啡杯、T恤二选一
2. 优秀贡献奖（2名）：每月最后一个工作日，评委会根据投稿内容的技术先进性、内容可读性、文章/视频阅读量三个维度进行打分，评选出2位优秀贡献奖，奖品是无线手机充电支架。



## <font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">投稿作品要求</font>
+ <font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">作品层次结构及逻辑清晰且必须是原创；</font>
+ <font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">禁止发布广告类内容信息；</font>
+ <font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">禁止发布涉政、暴恐、违禁等敏感内容。</font>

issueDTO.title: fix BINARY_SUBSCR to use __class_getitem__ as needed  (__getitem__() missing 1 required positional argument: 'idx' )
issueDTO.description:
*Note*: If you have a model or program that is not supported yet but should be, please use the program coverage template.

## 🐛 Bug

`InterpreterError: Encountered exception TypeError: SequenceWrapperMethods.__getitem__() missing 1 required positional argument: 'idx' while tracing `

### To Reproduce

```
def fn():
   return list[int]
thunder.jit(fn)()
```

fails.

### Additional context

The error is becauee the _binary_subscr_handler in thunder/core/interpreter.py always uses __getitem__ instead of __class_getitem__ when the tos1 is a type.

It would want a test along the lines of the above in test_interpreter.py .

The relevance is that Transformers 4.53 introduced something of that in the jitted codepath.

@tejapulagam if you want to work on this, please self-assign.

cc @lantiga

issueDTO.title: Remove MongoDBProxy
issueDTO.description:
We install [a fork of MongoDBPRoxy](https://github.com/openedx/MongoDBProxy) and use it in edx-platform (search for `mongodb_proxy`). The package is extremely simple -- it just makes is so that pymongo automatically retries certain queries N times.

I hear that this feature is now baked into Mongo and/or pymongo. If we can take advantage of that builtin feature, it would be great to remove this custom mongodb_proxy package from edx-platform and archive the repo so that we don't have maintain it anymore.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [x] Confirm that the functionality of mongodb_proxy can be recreated using builtin mongo features
- [ ] Switch edx-platform to use the builtin mongo retry feature, and uninstall mongodbproxy from edx-platform
- [ ] Manually smoke-test that Studio and LMS still run when mongodb_proxy is uninstalled.
- [ ] File an [Axim Systems Request](https://github.com/openedx/axim-engineering/issues/new/choose), asking that MongoDBProxy be archived.

issueDTO.title: storage_service/get_natural_endpoints has no way to pass a key containing a colon character
issueDTO.description:
As noted by @KrzaQ:
> How do I use nodetool getendpoints with compound keys? The internet advice seems to be pass the key separated by colon (e.g. nodetool getendpoints mykeyspace superheroes "peter:parker" ), but what do I do if the key itself contains colons?
In my case - audit.audit_log, one of the columns is of type timestamp, so a value could be 2023-12-31 00:00:00.000000+0000 .
I tried following the java code for the tool, but no luck yet.

To enable support at the jmx/nodetool level (or scylla-nodetool), the scylla api needs to support a way to pass key values containing `:`, otherwise they are recognized as composite keys, with the column as key delimiter.

Since the key is passed over an http-based interface I suggest to allow encoding `:` characters using the standard http encoding as `%3A` substrings (`seastar::http::internal::url_decode` can be used to decode such strings).
comments: Although it isn't specified in the RFC (https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986#section-3.4) many libraries allow passing the same query parameter multiple times, e.g. `somequery?key=3&key=4`. If Seastar doesn't mess this up (e.g., by using a map instead of a list), this can be a way to specify two key components without needing to invent yet another serialization format.

According to https://support.datastax.com/s/article/HOW-TO-Specify-composite-partition-keys-for-SSTable-utilities, the colon is expected to work - although this isn't officially specified in the nodetool getendpoints documentation so I'm note sure we should follow this bad advice:

The reason why this is a bad syntax is that it makes keys like "a:b" ambiguous - is it one component with the ":" character, or two components? It's not an issue of implementation, it's a bug in nodetool syntax that makes this case ambiguous and nodetool has no idea what the user intended.

> Since the key is passed over an http-based interface I suggest to allow encoding `:` characters using the standard http encoding as `%3A` substrings (`seastar::http::internal::url_decode` can be used to decode such strings).

I'm not sure if that was your intention, but such encoding (which obviously has to happen when building the REST API URL), will not help to differentiate whether "a:b" is two components or one with a colon. Also, if the nodetool API is already ambgious (what does the "a:b" the user passed mean?) there is no way that additional encoding can fix it.

If you change anything in this area, please don't forget to add tests.

From the api standpoint what I had in mind is to pass `key=a%3Ab` if the non-composite key (or one of its components) contains `:`.
The user can pass that to nodetool as well.

That said, allowing passing multiple components as request parameters is possible too, though with the current interface it is not intuitive to assume that the multiple key parameters indicate multiple components of a composite key rather than multiple keys, if the API supported returning the natural endpoints for multiple keys.

Note that `%3A` is supported for `keyspace:table` "tuples" when passed as a single parameter or as a comma-separated list of `keyspace:table`, to support keyspace or table names containing `:`.

> From the api standpoint what I had in mind is to pass `key=a%3Ab` if the non-composite key (or one of its components) contains `:`. The user can pass that to nodetool as well.

`key=a%3Ab` is the url-encoded form of setting key to `a:b`. But now that Scylla receives it, how does it know if this was intended to be a string key `a:b` or two components?

Maybe you were thinking of encoding **twice**? If that's the case, the first layer of encoding doesn't need to be URL encoding. Just the outer layer of encoding must be.

Are you sure about what you said about `keyspace:table` allowing real ":"? Last time I checked, I found that at least in one context, you are only allowed to have colons in the table name, not keyspace name (e.g., in Alternator GSI), and what happens is simply that Scylla splits only on the first colon, so `xyz:abc:qwe` means that `xyz` is the keyspace, `abc:qwe` is the table. That's a different thing that what you are hoping to do here.
Can't we use key:"value:has:colons"?

> Can't we use key:"value:has:colons"?

Of course, that's one way to represent it (with taking care of escaping `"` characters within the string if needed).
But we need to be consistent, and the proposal to use %3A to encode column characters is consistent with an http-based REST API.

Introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. `ckey`, that can be given multiple times to build the key is also an elegant option that is consistent with REST API.

Like @nyh said, we still need to fix the nodetool layer to support composite keys containing `:`.
There, one could use string quoting or even hex encoding to represent binary key values.

> Of course, that's one way to represent it (with taking care of escaping `"` characters within the string if needed). But we need to be consistent, and the proposal to use %3A to encode column characters is consistent with an http-based REST API.

But it won't be "consistent" - you'll need to run the URL encoding **twice**, which is possible, but not something traditionally done in HTTP. So we gain nothing by making the "inner" encoding also another invocation of the URL encoding, it can be something else like quotes or backslashing colons or something. Whatever this inner encoding is, it will need to be documented.
 
> Introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. `ckey`, that can be given multiple times to build the key is also an elegant option that is consistent with REST API.

Yes, this is similar to what I suggested above, although theoretically you don't even need to change the existing option "key" if you just allow it to be given multiple times - unless giving a key multiple times has another meaning in the API (maybe an OR of several different keys)? @amnonh would know.

> > Of course, that's one way to represent it (with taking care of escaping `"` characters within the string if needed). But we need to be consistent, and the proposal to use %3A to encode column characters is consistent with an http-based REST API.
> 
> But it won't be "consistent" - you'll need to run the URL encoding **twice**, which is possible, but not something traditionally done in HTTP. So we gain nothing by making the "inner" encoding also another invocation of the URL encoding, it can be something else like quotes or backslashing colons or something. Whatever this inner encoding is, it will need to be documented.
> 
> > Introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. `ckey`, that can be given multiple times to build the key is also an elegant option that is consistent with REST API.
> 
> Yes, this is similar to what I suggested above, although theoretically you don't even need to change the existing option "key" if you just allow it to be given multiple times - unless giving a key multiple times has another meaning in the API (maybe an OR of several different keys)? @amnonh would know.

Currently, it's a singleton, see:
https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/blob/f4bd86384b6ffbcab9af876f83b288bf3e83eab3/api/api-doc/storage_service.json#L565-L568
And we also have this limitation: https://github.com/scylladb/seastar/issues/693

> And we also have this limitation:#693

Wrong link?
Sorry, it's a seastar issue, updated the commnet

Another user just encountered this bug, being unable to use "nodetool getendpoints" with a partition key value that contained the ":"  character. That user, like probably a majority of users, had a single-column (non-compound) partition key. 

We can easily create a fix  for such users: partition_key::from_nodetool_style_string() could check if the schema has a single partition-key component, and if so, avoid the "split on :" logic entirely.

This fix will **not** help in the more general case of compound partition keys (for which an API change is required, as described above), but it would have helped this user, and all other users who have non-compound partition keys.

@amnonh suggested an API improvement for the general case (of compound partition keys, that do need a separator character): 
```
It's also possible to allow the user to override the delimiter (like we do in sed) for this cases
```
Adding this feature to the REST API will be easy, but adding it to nodetool will require a new option.
If my idea above for single-component partition key not splitting at all is _also_ implemented, many users including the ones that noticed this problem will not actually need to use this option.

@bhalevy I've created https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/pull/24720 based on @nyh idea.
I'm not sure it's the right approach, but you can take it from here

> [@bhalevy](https://github.com/bhalevy) I've created [#24720](https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/pull/24720) based on [@nyh](https://github.com/nyh) idea. I'm not sure it's the right approach, but you can take it from here

It's a good start and as @nyh said in https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/issues/16596#issuecomment-2961866634, it doesn't solve all cases, but the common case of a simple, single column partition key.

> [@paszkow](https://github.com/paszkow), [@tarasveretilnyk](https://github.com/tarasveretilnyk) that could be another good issue for ramping up
> 
> Can you please take [a8eaf02](https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/commit/a8eaf0253c7d7456e645bcc656270b59e9cc4230) forward, and add a unit test for it as well?

Regarding "unit" (not really) tests, I think there can/should be two levels of them:

1.  Test in test/rest_api that checks the REST API request in two cases: single-partition-key-column-and-colon-in-the-key and two-partition-key-column-and-colon-used-as-separator. Perhaps we already have a test for the latter case?
2. Test in dtest or test/nodetool (I'm not up to date on what's right) that checks the nodetool command, not rest api. What we change in the REST API **should** translate also to the nodetool command but it's not obvious that it does and should be tested. Some ideas raised in this issue required even more explicit changes to nodetool that would need to be tested.

Please also see my recommendation in https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/pull/24720 to improve the commit message to say exactly what we're fixing and what we aren't, and also consider which documentation we need to update to explain the situation with the colon.

> 
> [@denesb](https://github.com/denesb) should review

issueDTO.title: Provide a way to enable both quantity_support and time_support in one go
issueDTO.description: In https://github.com/astropy/astropy/pull/8782 we discussed that it would be nice to have a way to enable both ``time_support`` and ``quantity_support``, maybe e.g. ``astropy_support``.
comments:
Actually the `contextlib.contexmanager` implementation also allows using it as a decorator

quoting from https://docs.python.org/3/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.contextmanager
> [contextmanager()](https://docs.python.org/3/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.contextmanager) uses [ContextDecorator](https://docs.python.org/3/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.ContextDecorator) so the context managers it creates can be used as decorators as well as in [with](https://docs.python.org/3/reference/compound_stmts.html#with) statements. When used as a decorator, a new generator instance is implicitly created on each function call (this allows the otherwise “one-shot” context managers created by [contextmanager()](https://docs.python.org/3/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.contextmanager) to meet the requirement that context managers support multiple invocations in order to be used as decorators).

So my preference is to go with the first approach as it's simpler. Note that it is generally not recommended to call so-called dunder[^1] methods like `__enter__` and `__exit__` directly, so I would favor something like:

```python
from contextlib import contextmanager, ExitStack

@contextmanager
def astro_support():
    with ExitStack() as stack:
        stack.enter_context(quantity_support())
        stack.enter_context(time_support())
        yield
```

[^1]: "dunder" is short for "double underscore" and is a common way to refer to Python's protocols that are named with two leading and two trailing underscores
Yes, this works perfectly. I have opened a PR #17575. I will update the changelog and add a test case shortly!

Hi @astropy/core team 👋
I'd love to help close out issue #8860 (“enable both quantity_support and time_support in one go”). I saw PR #17979 is already addressing this great start!
I can help with:

Adding unit tests (both context manager and decorator use cases)
Updating the visualization documentation
Would it be helpful if I take this on next?

issueDTO.title: Event Stream API: Dysfunctional "queue" Parameter
issueDTO.description:
## Describe the bug

The [Icinga 2 API Event Stream documentation](https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-2/latest/doc/12-icinga2-api/#event-streams) states that the required `queue` parameter used to subscribe to the Event Stream must have an "[u]nique queue name [and] [m]ultiple HTTP clients can use the same queue as long as they use the same event types and filter".

However, currently there is no functionality bound to the `queue` parameter next to a check for its presence.
https://github.com/Icinga/icinga2/blob/2c9117b4f71e00b2072e7dbe6c4ea4e48c882a87/lib/remote/eventshandler.cpp#L81-L86

It seems like it's logic was removed in #7088, especially 81713d0509e5c686a4d038a237f367d438703120. Within this PR, the change regarding `queue` was [noted](https://github.com/Icinga/icinga2/pull/7088#issuecomment-480358802), but no further decisions were made.

## To Reproduce

n/a

## Expected behavior

I would expect the documentation to match the actual logic.

As I recently started using the Event Stream API a lot, I relied on the documented behavior, but, fortunately, did not ran in any errors - or at least non I know of. Thus, if the uniqueness constraint is not enforced anyway, maybe drop the whole parameter or change the code again to match the documented restrictions. As I myself do not know Icinga 2's internal well enough, I cannot say what would be best.

## Screenshots

n/a

## Your Environment

n/a

## Additional context

n/a
comments: Hi, I’m Egor from [OSS Revival](https://github.com/Project-OSS-Revival). We specialize in revitalizing and maintaining open-source projects for long-term stability. I’ll work on this issue, ensuring it stays aligned with the project’s original vision.

repository.name: icinga2

summary.main: The 'queue' parameter in the Event Stream API is currently dysfunctional, allowing multiple HTTP clients to use the same queue without enforcing the uniqueness constraint, which is contrary to the documented behavior and may lead to unexpected results or errors.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the 'queue' parameter to have a unique queue name and for multiple HTTP clients to use the same queue as long as they use the same event types and filter, as documented in the Icinga 2 API Event Stream documentation.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by re-enforcing the uniqueness constraint on the 'queue' parameter in the Event Stream API, ensuring the documented behavior is matched with the actual logic. Alternatively, the 'queue' parameter could be removed or modified to match the current implementation.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'bug', 'area/api', 'area/documentation', and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with before/after changes or documentation updates if possible.

issueDTO.title: DataFlex - add support for this language
issueDTO.description:
<!--

👋 If you have the time and know-how, send us a pull-request: everybody is welcome to contribute!
Otherwise, fill out the following fields as best you can.

-->
## Language name
DataFlex

## URL of example repository
https://github.com/DataFlexCode
https://github.com/NilsSve 

## URL of syntax highlighting grammar
https://docs.dataaccess.com/dataflexhelp/mergedProjects/LanguageGuide/Language_Guide.htm

## Most popular extensions
*.src,*.pkg,*.vw,*.dg,*.sl,*.bp,*.wo,*.inc
<!--

List the extensions commonly used by this language.
*.src,*.pkg,*.vw,*.dg,*.sl,*.bp,*.wo,*.inc

-->

## Detected language
DataFlex
<!--

What language are files for this language being identified as, if any?
DataFlex
-->
comments:
DataFlex uses a lot of different file extensions, some of which will likely have conflicts. Modern DataFlex uses a common workspace structure, such as `AppSrc/cMyClass.pkg`. Searching for [NOT is:fork path:Appsrc/**.pkg](https://github.com/search?type=code&q=NOT+is%3Afork+path%3AAppsrc%2F**.pkg
) narrows it down to effectively DataFlex source code files and provides 900+ results. Many of the other file extensions are nowhere near that many, so it won't meet the minimum usage requirements.

Given that there are so many file extensions in use, maybe a better initial approach could be to add support for DataFlex without specifying `extensions` or `filenames` to avoid conflicts. And DataFlex source repositories can use `.gitattributes` overrides for the relevant extensions instead. Obviously not ideal, but it would at least provide recognition for the DataFlex language, and that's a great starting point.

I see there is some precedence for languages without specifying file extensions, such as for Elvish transcripts from PR #6302, which is mainly used inside markdown files. @lildude and @NilsSve, I can help and put up a PR for adding the DataFlex language without specifying any file extensions, would that work?

Hi Sonny,

If you are asking me, yes, that would help! The current repositories at @NilsSve are using .gitattributes exactly as suggested.

> I see there is some precedence for languages without specifying file extensions, such as for Elvish transcripts from PR [#6302](https://github.com/github-linguist/linguist/pull/6302), which is mainly used inside markdown files. [@lildude](https://github.com/lildude) and [@NilsSve](https://github.com/NilsSve), I can help and put up a PR for adding the DataFlex language without specifying any file extensions, would that work?

It would "work" but it won't be accepted. The Elvish exception is because there isn't a common extension as it's predominantly used in a markdown files. This is not the case with DataFlex.

I know nothing about DataFlex but wikipedia says "DataFlex is an object-oriented high-level programming language and a fourth generation visual tool for developing Windows, web and mobile software applications on one framework-based platform."

We do not add support for frameworks, hence we support Ruby, but not Rails, so the right thing to do is concentrate on only the language files. I'd expect the language to have a common extension and structure that can be identified.  This should be what is added first, assuming usage meets requirements, and then users can use the overrides to classify the other extensions if they want.

If the language predominantly uses a generic extension like `.pkg` (poor design decision IMO), this can be added the `generic.yml` file and a heuristic will be used to identify the language, but be warned: this heuristic _must_ be very accurate to only identify DataFlex files and must be linear and performant. It's better for this regex to under identify DataFlex files than misidentify other languages.

repository.description: Language Savant. If your repository's language is being reported incorrectly, send us a pull request!
repository.name: linguist

summary.main: The issue is about adding support for the DataFlex language, which is an object-oriented high-level programming language used for developing Windows, web, and mobile software applications. The language has a common extension and structure that can be identified, and the fix should concentrate on only the language files.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the DataFlex language to be recognized and supported by the Linguist tool without specifying file extensions, and for the tool to accurately identify DataFlex files and avoid misidentifying other languages.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by adding support for DataFlex without specifying file extensions, and using `.gitattributes` overrides for the relevant extensions instead. This approach would provide recognition for the DataFlex language and avoid conflicts with other file extensions.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'Good First Issue' and 'Add Language', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle. The expected behavior is to add support for the DataFlex language without specifying file extensions, and a pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with the proposed changes.

issueDTO.title: Error when changing the name of a new Debug Configuration
issueDTO.description:
<!-- Thank you for reporting this issue! -->
<!-- The following template is highly recommended to trigger an efficient course of actions: it's pretty suitable if you're not familiar with the project as it will guide you in sharing the most important information. If you're not comfortable with this template for your particular report, feel free to erase it and write your report from scratch -->

Let's make sure issue is not already fixed in latest builds first.

- [x] I verified I can reproduce this issue against Eclipse 2025-06 (https://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/)

## Steps to reproduce

From a fresh installation and clean workspace:

* I open the debug configuration
* Create a new configuration (for example Eclipse Application) and save clicking in Apply button
* Modify the name of the same debug configuration
* Click on "new launch configuration"
* A Pop up ask for saving the first config -> click on save

I expected: the first config is saved and the new config can be editing

But got: the first config is saved but I got this error message and the new configuration has not been created 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0e7884b7-65b1-4f7a-92d5-7114f4dee7c3)

## Here is some relevant log output

There is no exception in the console

## Tested under this environment:
* OS & version: Windows 10
* Eclipse IDE/Platform version (as shown in *Help > About*): ~Version: 2025-06 (4.36.0) - Build id: 20250605-1316~ **2021-09 (4.21)** and maybe even earlier, I didn't look further (@fedejeanne, see https://github.com/eclipse-platform/eclipse.platform/issues/2003#issuecomment-3022494651)

## Community

- [x] I understand reporting an issue to this OSS project does not mandate anyone to fix it. Other contributors may consider the issue, or not, at their own convenience. The most efficient way to get it fixed is that I fix it myself and contribute it back as a good quality patch to the project.
comments: I now that the exception is throw here `org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.getInfo(LaunchConfiguration)` beacause the `config` does not exist anymore

Thank you for reporting this, @pdeville2 !

I tested it in a very old installation I had around (**2021-09 (4.21)**) and it was reproducible too. I didn't went further back but I assume this must have been there for ages, glad that you caught it!

Would you be open to proposing a PR to fix it? Or even a smaller PR to even properly show the error in the _Error Log_ view?

I only peeked at it and found the error message in the code, so those would be the places to start digging :-)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/985c3a3f-10f6-4a9b-b5a4-44313fa4d2be)

Hello @fedejeanne, I proposed a PR for the display of the exception in the Error Log View, I think is quite generic for all call of `org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.AbstractLaunchConfigurationAction.errorDialog(CoreException)` but as far as I car see each time the method is call the exception is not wrote in the error log, so we should not get an exception twice.

Concerning a real fix, I don't have any idea for now.

I check a bit what is the problem here. 

Here are my conclusions for today (not sure I get more time for this) : 
* after the save of the previous configuration, the new file has been created and the old one destroyed
* but when the `org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.CreateLaunchConfigurationAction.performAction()` is called for the creation of a new launch config the selection is not updated in the tree, however this action is based on the selection to be able to get type of the new launch config to create
* I don't now how to change/refresh the selection for the `CreateLaunchConfigurationAction`

Thank you for the analysis!

I added some tags to indicate that someone else is allowed to work on this since you might not get more time. I hope that's OK :-) 

You are more than welcome to keep working on it though!

They found that after the save of the previous configuration, the new file has been created and the old one destroyed, and the selection is not updated in the tree when the `CreateLaunchConfigurationAction` is called.

issueDTO.title: [feat.]: Methods to delete the registered modules
issueDTO.description:
## Motivation

<!--
Please shortly describe by example what feature you want to use or what idea you want to see in the current WasmEdge project.
-->

In WasmEdge C-SDK, there is no provisioned method to remove the modules registerd by VM.
 
I can understand the reason is that it's vm owns those modules. However it's still such a wasting behavior if u don't delete the registered module after using it.

Maybe we can create some methods like this:
```cpp
WASMEDGE_CAPI_EXPORT extern void
WasmEdge_VMDeleteRegisteredModule(const WasmEdge_VMContext *Cxt,
                               const WasmEdge_String ModuleName);
```
comments: And when we invoke this function, the VM could release its ownership and delete this named module.

@q82419 
What do you think?

As discussed before, the module instances may have dependencies: module A imports the functions of module B when instantiating.
Therefore, this function is not safe if delete the specific registered module, or it may cause core dump when execution.
As the steps in [module instantiation](https://webassembly.github.io/spec/core/exec/modules.html#instantiation), the [external value (the instance address in store)](https://webassembly.github.io/spec/core/exec/runtime.html#syntax-externval) should be able to be found. Therefore in WasmEdge we did the strict linking to reduce the instance searching time when executing.
I think this function is only available if we implement the dynamic WASM module instance linker.

You can use the `WasmEdge_VMCleanUp` to delete all registered modules without WASI and plug-ins.

> module A imports the functions of module B when instantiating

Maybe I could call it "synchronization problem" ?

IMO, this problem should be considered by developers. That is, When a developer calls `WasmEdge_VMDeleteRegisteredModule`, he should ensure that the registered module isn't or will never become the dependency of other modules (from other threads) anymore.

It's just like the ModuleInstance owned by developer: one can call `WasmEdge_ModuleInstanceDelete` whenver he want.

> > module A imports the functions of module B when instantiating
> 
> Maybe I could call it "synchronization problem" ?
> 
> IMO, this problem should be considered by developers. That is, When a developer calls `WasmEdge_VMDeleteRegisteredModule`, he should ensure that the registered module isn't or will never become the dependency of other modules (from other threads) anymore.
> 
> It's just like the ModuleInstance owned by developer: one can call `WasmEdge_ModuleInstanceDelete` whenver he want.

Yes, you're right, developers should ensure the life-cycle of the modules.
That's why we have `WasmEdge_ModuleInstanceDelete` API -- developers can delete the module if they use the `WasmEdge_ExecutorContext` but not the `WasmEdge_VMContext` APIs to run WASM.

In the design of WasmEdge, not like the other WASM runtimes, we provide a more convenient `VM` objects to let developers to instantiate and run WASM more easily and quickly than the traditional WASM C API. In this case, I think the `VM` should give more protections to prevent from segmentation fault, such as this module deletion case.
Of course if you use the `Executor` and `Store` to instantiate a WASM module, you can easily to this detailed control.
I think we can implement this API if we implemented the dependency tree of registered modules.

cc @hydai  do you think we can implement this API directly or after implementing the dependency tree of modules in store?

> > > module A imports the functions of module B when instantiating
> > 
> > 
> > Maybe I could call it "synchronization problem" ?
> > IMO, this problem should be considered by developers. That is, When a developer calls `WasmEdge_VMDeleteRegisteredModule`, he should ensure that the registered module isn't or will never become the dependency of other modules (from other threads) anymore.
> > It's just like the ModuleInstance owned by developer: one can call `WasmEdge_ModuleInstanceDelete` whenver he want.
> 
> Yes, you're right, developers should ensure the life-cycle of the modules. That's why we have `WasmEdge_ModuleInstanceDelete` API -- developers can delete the module if they use the `WasmEdge_ExecutorContext` but not the `WasmEdge_VMContext` APIs to run WASM.
> 
> In the design of WasmEdge, not like the other WASM runtimes, we provide a more convenient `VM` objects to let developers to instantiate and run WASM more easily and quickly than the traditional WASM C API. In this case, I think the `VM` should give more protections to prevent from segmentation fault, such as this module deletion case. Of course if you use the `Executor` and `Store` to instantiate a WASM module, you can easily to this detailed control. I think we can implement this API if we implemented the dependency tree of registered modules.
> 
> cc @hydai do you think we can implement this API directly or after implementing the dependency tree of modules in store?

@hydai Just in case this issue has escaped your attention, I would like to kindly remind you about it.

> do you think we can implement this API directly or after implementing the dependency tree of modules in store?

We can have this API first with a big warning message and then implement the dependency tree in the future. Maybe we can have it in the 0.13 release?
Since this is not a critical issue, I mark it as a `good first issue`. A PR is welcome.

Hi @hydai, I would like to work on this.
Since I'm new to open source, would you recommend any material to go through before starting to work on this?
I have gone through the documentation and set things up on my machine.

Hi @vishwahaha 
Since this one is a C API header and C++ implementation, you will need a basic idea about these languages. And one thing is that you can directly add this function and do some tests on it. Please feel free to ask anything if you have any questions.

Hi @hydai 
I was writing tests for `WasmEdge_VMDeleteRegisteredModule`, I noticed that `WasmEdge_VMListRegisteredModuleLength` return `12` after instantiating with `WasmEdge_VMCreate` in the APICoreTest. Can you tell me why this happens? Is this related to the initial configuration object?
Also, should I include the test in the PR?

Hi @vishwahaha
Sorry for the late response, I must miss your previous messages.

> @hydai I have written the function for now, Can you tell me what/how should I include the "big warning" message? Also should I include the test in the PR later?

1. You should add a warning message in the comments before the function.
2. Yes, please.



> Hi @hydai I was writing tests for `WasmEdge_VMDeleteRegisteredModule`, I noticed that `WasmEdge_VMListRegisteredModuleLength` return `12` after instantiating with `WasmEdge_VMCreate` in the APICoreTest. Can you tell me why this happens? Is this related to the initial configuration object? Also, should I include the test in the PR?

1. There are some pre-registered modules, such as WASI. It's related to the initial configuration.
2. You should register a new one and delete it. Not delete the existing one.

Hello @hydai , I would like to work on this.
Since I'm new to open source, would you recommend any material to go through before starting to work on this?
I have gone through the documentation and set things up on my machine.

> Hello @hydai , I would like to work on this. Since I'm new to open source, would you recommend any material to go through before starting to work on this? I have gone through the documentation and set things up on my machine.

Assuming you know how C SDK works, if not, checking the C SDK related files and docs first.

> > Hello @hydai , I would like to work on this. Since I'm new to open source, would you recommend any material to go through before starting to work on this? I have gone through the documentation and set things up on my machine.
> 
> Assuming you know how C SDK works, if not, checking the C SDK related files and docs first.

Yes I have read C SDK docs how to proceed next.

Hi! @hydai 
Is this issue still available to work on? 
I would like to work on it.
It's still available. Assigned.

issueDTO.title: Standardize epsilon values with domain-specific constants in HLSL shaders
issueDTO.description:
## Problem

Currently, epsilon values are hardcoded throughout the HLSL shader codebase with various precision levels (1e-4, 1e-5, 1e-6, 1e-8, 1e-10), making maintenance difficult and potentially introducing inconsistencies within similar mathematical contexts.

## Analysis

### Current Epsilon Distribution:
- **1e-6f**: 7 occurrences (6 in BRDF visibility functions + 1 in Diffuse_OrenNayar)
- **1e-5**: 12+ occurrences (most common - PBR dot products, thresholds)
- **1e-4**: 8 occurrences (lighting radius/distance checks, geometric tests)
- **1e-8**: 2 occurrences (specialized - glints ellipse ratios)
- **1e-10**: 4 occurrences (spherical harmonics weight normalization)

### Mathematical Contexts Identified:

#### 1. Division Protection (Current: 1e-6f)
Used in BRDF visibility functions to prevent division by zero:
```hlsl
return rcp(max(Vis_SmithV * Vis_SmithL, 1e-6f));
```
**Files:** package/Shaders/Common/BRDF.hlsli

#### 2. Dot Product Clamping (Current: 1e-5)
Ensures lighting terms don't go to zero:
```hlsl
float NdotL = clamp(dot(N, L), 1e-5, 1);
float NdotV = saturate(abs(dot(N, V)) + 1e-5);
```
**Files:** package/Shaders/Common/PBR.hlsli, various feature shaders

#### 3. Distance/Radius Thresholds (Current: 1e-4)
Used for geometric and lighting distance checks:
```hlsl
float distance = max(length(lightVector), 1e-4);
```
**Files:** Various lighting feature shaders

#### 4. Specialized Precision (Current: 1e-8, 1e-10)
- **1e-8**: Glints ellipse ratio calculations
- **1e-10**: Spherical harmonics weight normalization

## Proposed Solution

Add domain-specific epsilon constants to Math.hlsli using #define to match current HLSL constant practices:

```hlsl
// Domain-specific epsilon values for numerical stability
#define EPSILON_DIVISION    1e-6f    // For rcp() division protection
#define EPSILON_DOT_CLAMP   1e-5f    // For NdotL/NdotV clamping
#define EPSILON_DISTANCE    1e-4f    // For distance/radius thresholds
#define EPSILON_GLINTS      1e-8f    // For glints calculations
#define EPSILON_WEIGHT_SUM  1e-10f   // For weight normalization
```

## Files Requiring Updates

Based on analysis, the following files contain hardcoded epsilon values that should be replaced:

- package/Shaders/Common/BRDF.hlsli (1e-6f → EPSILON_DIVISION)
- package/Shaders/Common/PBR.hlsli (1e-5 → EPSILON_DOT_CLAMP)
- features/DynamicCubemaps/Shaders/DynamicCubemaps/DynamicCubemaps.hlsli (0.00001 → EPSILON_DOT_CLAMP)
- features/Skylighting/Shaders/Skylighting/Skylighting.hlsli (1e-10 → EPSILON_WEIGHT_SUM)
- features/ScreenSpaceGI/Shaders/ScreenSpaceGI/ScreenSpaceGI.hlsli (1e-4 → EPSILON_DISTANCE)
- features/TerrainBlending/Shaders/TerrainBlending/TerrainBlending.hlsli (1e-4 → EPSILON_DISTANCE)
- Various other feature shader files

## Benefits

1. **Consistency**: Same epsilon values used for identical mathematical purposes
2. **Maintainability**: Single location to adjust epsilon values if needed
3. **Documentation**: Clear intent through descriptive constant names
4. **Standards Compliance**: Uses #define convention matching existing HLSL constants

## Implementation Notes

- Different epsilon values serve mathematically distinct purposes with different sensitivity requirements
- Performance impact is zero - different epsilon values have no measurable performance cost on modern GPUs
- Domain-specific precision is necessary to avoid either visible artifacts or unnecessary precision loss

## Related

- PR #1226: Added NaN prevention checks to BRDF visibility functions using 1e-6f values
- Discussion in PR #1226 comment thread about epsilon standardization

Backlinks:
- PR: https://github.com/doodlum/skyrim-community-shaders/pull/1226
- Comment: https://github.com/doodlum/skyrim-community-shaders/pull/1226#issuecomment-discussion

issueDTO.title: Add Pull Request Template to Standardize PRs and Improve the Review Process
issueDTO.description:
The repository currently doesn't have a pull request template. 
Adding a `pull_request_template.md` will help standardize PRs, ensure important information is included, and make the review process smoother.
Happy to open a PR for this if approved :)

## Example Template Proposal


## Description

_Provide a concise description of the change. Explain what this PR does and why it's needed._

_If applicable, describe any visual/UI changes or link to screenshots._

This pull request is categorized as a:

- [ ] New feature
- [ ] Bug fix
- [ ] Code refactor
- [ ] Documentation
- [ ] Other

## Related Issue(s)

_Reference any related issues. Use keywords like Fixes, Closes, or Resolves._

- Fixes: #  
- Related: #

## Checklist

- [ ] I have removed any unrelated changes from this PR
- [ ] I’ve run `just test` and ensured unit tests pass
- [ ] I’ve run `just typecheck` and resolved any typing issues
- [ ] I’ve run `just format` to auto-format code

If functionality was added or changed, were tests included?

- [ ] Yes, tests were added/updated
- [ ] No, and I understand this will likely delay review/merge
- [ ] N/A

## Platform/Environment Tested

- [ ] Linux/macOS
- [ ] Dev Container (VSCode)
- [ ] Other:

## Notes for Reviewers

_Optional: Add anything important for the reviewer to know like edge cases, decisions made, etc._

_Note: Keep changes focused. If unrelated improvements or issues are discovered, consider opening a separate PR to maintain clarity and reviewability._
comments: Let's wait for Patrick opinion, but good proposal!

- `just test` (all unit tests must pass) or 
- `just test-all` (all tests: unit, integration & zksync must pass) ?

issueDTO.title: Github Copilot Metrics endpoint returning more than 28 days
issueDTO.description:
Hi,

it seems that Github Copilot Metrics endpoint is returning data since 11 of April. Being 1st of July that's more than 2 months which is not 28 days as it's stated in the github api documentation.

issueDTO.title: Recognising `Optional[str]` as json instead of a `str`
issueDTO.description:
What's broken: MCP JAM incorrectly parses Optional[str] type annotations as complex JSON objects instead of simple string parameters.

Reproduce:

Create FastMCP tool with parameter: name: Annotated[Optional[str], Field(description="...")] = None
Open MCP JAM interface and load the tool
Attempt to call the tool with string parameter value "test string"
Expected vs. Actual: Should accept string value directly, actually wraps string in nested object structure {"name": {"name": "test string"}} causing Pydantic validation errors.

Environment: MCP JAM web interface (latest version), FastMCP server, macOS/Browser

Impact: Blocks all FastMCP tools using Optional parameters from being testable via MCP JAM interface. Workaround: Use str | None or plain  str with default  None instead of Optional[str].
comments: HI @MariusWilsch, thanks for bringing this up! @IgnacioC44 could you help us take a look at this?
No worries. So I remove the optional and use str with a default value then it works too. Not sure may even be a bug in fastmcp
For sure! I am working on it
Any updates on this @IgnacioC44? @oso-jukumari?

Hey @MariusWilsch could you confirm this is the error you were experimenting with? I tried to reproduce your issue![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/58e64612-0433-4be9-becb-0bc680ae191b)

---
@MariusWilsch 
Thank you for reporting this issue. After a detailed investigation, Here is a little suggestion maybe can help.
The root cause is not in the MCP JAM Inspector app’s frontend or proxy, but rather in how the backend of your mcp tool server generates the JSON schema for parameters defined as `Annotated[Optional[str], Field(...)] = None`.

### What’s Happening

- The backend generates a schema for `Optional[str]` using `Annotated` that looks like:
  ```json
  {
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
      "name": {
        "anyOf": [{ "type": "string" }, { "type": "null" }],
        "default": null,
        "description": "Your name"
      }
    }
  }
  ```
- The frontend UI interprets this as a complex type, resulting in the parameter being wrapped as `{ "name": { "name": "test string" } }` instead of `{ "name": "test string" }`.
- This causes Pydantic validation errors and prevents tools using this pattern from being testable via the MCP JAM interface.

### Why This Isn’t a Frontend Bug

- The frontend simply renders forms and serializes parameters based on the schema it receives from the backend.
- The proxy does not modify the request payloads.
- The issue is with the schema generation, not with how the UI sends or the proxy forwards the data.

### How to Fix or Work Around

- **Recommendation:**  
  Define your parameter as `name: str | None = Field(default=None, description="...")` (or, for older Python, `Optional[str] = Field(default=None, description="...")`).
- This produces a simpler schema (`type: ["string", "null"]`) that the UI will treat as a plain string (or null), and will serialize as `{ "name": "test string" }`.
- If you must use `Annotated`, ensure your backend (Pydantic/FastAPI) is up to date, as newer versions may handle this more gracefully.

---

I'd be glad in hear your comments about this suggestion and also I could check that you solved this with a similar option that is removing the optional and use str with a default value that works too. If you think that this solve your issue please let me know for close it.

issueDTO.description:
To group radio input, [an aria role `radiogroup` exists](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Roles/radiogroup_role). It is easily done using semantic HTML using fieldset and legend: ```html
Which is the best color?

``` For checkboxes, we want to use the "group" role, which is implicit in fieldset by default: ```html
Which is the best color?

``` It allows to easily target it using accessibility queries: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/12b96254-d979-4920-b506-f2cda974861a)
comments: @JLou le composant RadioInput est taggué avec le role radiogroup, est-ce nécessaire de rajouter un fieldset et une legend ?
Autant utiliser de la sémantique pour HTML pure non ?
MAJ de l'issue suite aux discussions internes sur l'implem voulue pour les checkboxes et radio input
Je peux travailler sur cette issue.

Je suis en train de travailler à une façon propre de faire cette modification (le couple fieldset/legend étant un peu particulier au niveau du rendu html et toutes les balises CSS ne fonctionnement pas sur le legend, qui doit obligatoirement être enfant direct du fieldset). Je vais essayer de terminer ma modif rapidement (je n'ai pas eu beaucoup de temps ces dernières semaines).

issueDTO.title: [Slash] Pagination should have appropriate aria-label
issueDTO.description:
For the pagination, there's no way to set some aria-label to distinguish different paginations.
For example if we have two paginations inside the same page, there is no possibility to set an aria-label on the component to separate them.

Also, the page link inside the pagination have no proper aria-label as well.
If we have page 1, 2 and 3, it will be shown as 1, 2 and 3 links to users giving zero indication of what exactly are those links.
comments: Je prends :)
I'm a Seasoned web Developer and I feel that this task should be a piece of cake

repository.description: CSS & React implementation of AXA's design systems

summary.main: The issue is that the pagination component and page links lack aria-label attributes, making it difficult for users to understand the purpose of each link, particularly in cases where there are multiple paginations within the same page.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the pagination component and page links to have an aria-label attribute that clearly indicates the purpose of each link, ensuring accessibility and usability for users.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by adding aria-label attributes to the pagination component and page links to provide a clear indication of what each link represents, allowing users to distinguish between different paginations.

issueDTO.title: [Docs]: Add BeeAI Framework client integration (Python & TypeScript)
issueDTO.description:
### 📚 Documentation Issue Summary

The documentation should include a new guide under `docs/docs/using/agents/` for integrating **BeeAI Framework** (https://framework.beeai.dev) with MCP Gateway.

BeeAI is a production-ready, dual-language (Python + TypeScript) framework for multi-agent workflows. It natively supports MCP via `MCPTool` and can interoperate with both `mcpgateway-wrapper` and SSE/HTTP transports.

---

### 📍 Location of the Problem

> Suggested location: `docs/docs/using/agents/beeai.md`  
> Also update: `.pages` in `docs/docs/using/agents/` to include `beeai.md`

Page: https://ibm.github.io/mcp-context-forge/using/agents/bee/
---

### ✏️ Type of Issue

* [x] Missing client documentation
* [x] New integration support

---

### 💡 Suggested Fix or Clarification

Follow the style used in `claude-desktop.md` and other client entries. Include:

- Brief overview of BeeAI Framework
- MCP integration via `MCPTool`
- Sample usage with `mcpgateway-wrapper`
- Optional section for SSE/WebSocket (if BeeAI supports it)
- Tips for configuring tool discovery
- Links to BeeAI official documentation

Include both stdio and REST variants for completeness.

---

### 🧩 Additional Notes

BeeAI supports observability, custom memory layers, and multi-LLM routing-consider noting how Gateway features like caching or SSE streams complement those workflows.

repository.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
repository.name: mcp-context-forge

issueDTO.title: Document usage of ~/.lima/NAME/ssh.config
issueDTO.description:
### Description

Users should add this to their ~/.ssh/config:

```
Include ~/.lima/*/ssh.config
```

To be able to connect to the lima instances with the ssh command:

```sh
ssh lima-{NAME}
```

See more useful examples in https://github.com/lima-vm/lima/issues/3613#issuecomment-2949736880

We mention ssh.config here:
https://lima-vm.io/docs/usage/
comments:
Another example:

```shell
rsync -a -e ssh . lima-default:/tmp/repo
```

Depending on the rest of your ssh config, you might have to include:

```
Match all
Include ~/.lima/*/ssh.config
```

i.e. if you had already some `Host` entries in the file, since before...

Other scenarios, for the lima documentation:
 
* https://github.com/lima-vm/lima/discussions/1890 - VSCode
* https://github.com/lima-vm/lima/discussions/3605 - Ansible
* `sftp sftp://lima-almalinux-10` (from issue 852) - EDIT: maybe **not** filezilla: https://trac.filezilla-project.org/ticket/8450
* `sshfs lima-almalinux-10: /tmp/alma` - Note: sshfs has some issues on non-Linux platforms, like macOS or Windows

repository.name: lima

summary.main: The issue requires documenting the usage of ~/.lima/NAME/ssh.config, which should be added to the user's ~/.ssh/config file to enable connection to lima instances with the ssh command.

summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by adding a new section to the lima documentation explaining how to add the specified configuration to the user's ~/.ssh/config file. This may involve creating a new page or updating an existing one with the necessary information.

A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with clear documentation on how to add the specified configuration to the user's ~/.ssh/config file.

issueDTO.title: [FEATURE] Feature Comparison Table
issueDTO.description:
## Feature Description

Add a feature comparison table to the library’s documentation(README). The table will highlight the capabilities of the library compared to similar libraries.

---

## Use Case

A feature comparison table helps users quickly understand what makes this library unique and why they should choose it over alternatives.

---

## Proposed Solution

Create a Markdown table to compare features such as performance, supported locales, or dependency size. Focus on areas where the library excels and keep the table updated with new features.

---

## Additional Context

Include this table in the README.

---

## Pseudo Code

```markdown
| Feature                  | This Library    | Library A       | Library B       |
|--------------------------|-----------------|-----------------|-----------------|
| Random String Generator  | ✅             | ✅             | ✅             |
| CSV to JSON Conversion   | ✅             | ✅             | ❌             |
| Locale Support           | ✅ (US, UK)     | ❌             | ✅ (US, FR, DE) |
| Dependency-Free          | ✅             | ❌             | ❌             |
